answers.answer: "now show increased liver values"What are your AST and ALT results? If they are above normal as you say, what other tests have you had? Has the doctor mentioned seeing a Hepatologist, liver desease specialist? Did the lab test Creatinine (kidney) functions? Have you been screened for Hepatitis A, B or C?You also mention "my labs which have always been normal.." What labs - Chemistry, Serology, Hematology?"my weight does not change. I eat no refined sugars"Cereals contains large amounts of sugar! What about fruits or vegies?Your unhealthy diet is contributing your negative health.

oh my do get a different doctor, I think you are right,there is something else going on there besides your diabetes, and a good doctor will start you on the proper tests to find out whats wrong goodluck.

question: I am 41 almost 42 and have been diabetic for the past 10 years.  Up until 3 years ago my diabetes was under control but has steadily gotten worse and is now out of control.I take glipizide, metformin at their max dose and januvia (a newbie med).  My diabetes is still out of control.  my weight does not change.  I eat no refined sugars.In the last 18 mos my digestion has changed so dramatically that I can eat nothing but bland foods (mostly cereals).  I eat shredded wheat or malt o meal for 90 % of my meals because anything else gives me profuse diarheah.  I am so tired all the time that it takes everything I have to get up and go.  Then once I get up doing the most menial task wears me out for the day.  I have headaches but would not consider them chronic.In the last 3 mos I have started having low grade fevers and my labs which have always been normal now show increased liver values?????  my urination is fine and not painful, my bowels are 4 to 10 times per day (but have been for several years).  I have the chronic feeling of having swallowed a rock and have upper abdominal discomfort but not pain.  But my main complaint is that I am so exhausted all the time!My doctor does not address my symptoms at all, he just keep thinking that if my diabetes comes under control that the other problems will as well.  I am sick of this--I think that my diabetes out of control is a symptom of another problem and that if he would JUST look for the other problem and treat it, my diabetes would come under control.Please--any suggestions.
title: why can't they help me?
